body.p: For each of the following choose if this spinal cord structure, when viewed in cross section, would be located medially or paired laterally:

response.feedback: Incorrect. These would be lateral, whether or not there is also a lateral horn present.
Correct. Anterior and posterior horns would be lateral, whether or not there is also a lateral horn present.

part.hint: The spinal cord structures in cross-section are basically mirror images with medial structure connecting or separating the right and left halves.

response.feedback: Incorrect. these would be lateral along with lateral column.
Correct. Anterior and posterior columns would be lateral along with lateral column.

part.hint: The spinal cord structures in cross-section are basically mirror images with medial structure connecting or separating the right and left halves.

response.feedback: Correct. Anterior and posterior commissures connect the right and left corresponding paired white matter horns.
Incorrect. These connect the right and left corresponding paired white matter horns in the midline.

part.hint: The spinal cord structures in cross-section are basically mirror images with medial structure connecting or separating the right and left halves.

response.feedback: Correct. The gray commissure connects the right and left corresponding paired gray matter horns.
Incorrect. This connects the right and left corresponding paired gray matter horns in the midline.

part.hint: The spinal cord structures in cross-section are basically mirror images with medial structure connecting or separating the right and left halves.

response.feedback: Incorrect. These enter or leave the corresponding gray matter horns.
Correct. Anterior and posterior nerve roots enter or leave the corresponding gray matter horns.

part.hint: The spinal cord structures in cross-section are basically mirror images with medial structure connecting or separating the right and left halves.

response.feedback: Correct. The anterior fissure separates the right and left anterior horns.
Incorrect. This separates the right and left anterior horns.

part.hint: The spinal cord structures in cross-section are basically mirror images with medial structure connecting or separating the right and left halves.

response.feedback: Correct. The posterior sulcus separates the right and left posterior horns.
Incorrect. This separates the right and left posterior horns.

part.hint: The spinal cord structures in cross-section are basically mirror images with medial structure connecting or separating the right and left halves.
